page.title: 18PLANS FOR THE AREA
page.content: PLANS FOR THE AREA _CRYMLYN BOG The City Council, which owns most of the Crymly area, is to work jointly with the County Council and the Nature Conservancy Council to ensure that the area, including Crymlyn Burrows and Jersey Marine, be retained as open countryside. The importance of the Bog has been recognised as it has been declared a Site of Special Scientific Interest. The Council intends that the slopes around the Bog will be left mainly for farming. The natural landscape is to be kept (a stunted oak forest). A large part of the Bog will be left as a National Nature Reserve. It will only have limited access and will remain remote and undisturbed. Marked paths will be laid out so thet people will be able to go into the area to look at flora and fauna. The area around the old Tir John Power
